result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Pitts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard A Pitts is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard A Pitts was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Richard A Pitts was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard A Pitts in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:56 am. Amend count 1 & 2 mis 943.34 (1)(a) count 3 dismissed $200 plus costs/surcharges on count 1 & 2 as amended. State has complied with VN and no impact statement or request for restitution. Court amends and reads new charges/penalties. Defendant pleads NG. Court dismisses count 3. Court goes thru PLQ and finds defendant is entering plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering his plea and waiving his right to JT, factual basis, adjudges guility of counts 1 & 2 as amended. Final statments by parties. Court sentences to following:

Count 1 - Fine of $200 plus costs/surcharges $705.
Count 2 - Fine of $200 plus costs/surcharges $705.

60 DTP/CO

Appeal rights given.
Received 10/19/15. Letter from Attorney Strang, regarding request for motion hearing on October 21, 2015 to address outstanding issues with Pitts' Discovery Demand.

Defendant Richard A Pitts in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:17 AM. Also called State vs Jeanne Pitts (14CF154). State - here on a motion hearing filed by defense. Stange - hit a communication snag in getting case resolved and/or discovery issue resolved. Court goes thru discovery issues one by one. Court - to the extent that it exists, Court orders State to provide any discovery within 10 days. Court continues bond, matters are already set for further proceedings.
copy of letter from Attorney Smith to Eric Losee, (P&P)

Defendant Richard A Pitts in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:32 AM. Also called State vs Richard Pitts (14CF157). Richard Pitts appears with his counsel Jane Krueger Smith. State - not resolved - getting closer but needs to be set for STC and JT. Strang and Smith agree. 14CF154 is currently set for JT in January and is requesting a STC prior to that for stated reasons. Smith makes statement regarding some of the discovery and also requesting STC date. State has not made offer yet for stated reasons. Court continues bond on both cases. Smith to work with JA to get 3-4 day JT date(s). Strang can schedule a STC or MH date with the JA if he feels it is necessary.

Defendant Richard A Pitts in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:28 PM. Also called 14CF154 (State vs Jeannie Pitts). State - take full responsibility that full discovery has not been provided to defense counsel yet - will get full discovery to counsel shortly and asking that the sealed affidavit for the warrant be unsealed (14GF25). Stange makes statement regarding the initial discovery. Stange asking for the sealed document in CI's file to be unsealed and able to get copies of. Court states that the CI's information is no longer considered sealed as it was only sealed for certain dates and those dates have passed. Stange also ordered transcript from 10/1/14 hearing on CI case (09CF157). Court authorizes the defense counsel to request the transcript from 10/1/14 from the court reporter. State asking for two weeks to provide full discovery to both counsel. Stange and Smith have no problem with that. Court sets for another FPT - parties can appear by phone if it is not a plea and if not a plea and matter will be set for JT; if it is a plea, then all parties have to appear in person. State will be asking for at least a 5 day trial on 14CF154 and 3 day on 14CF157. Court continues bond on both cases. Stange will get the sealed affidavit in 14GF25 so Court does not need to deal with that request. Stange/Smith asking Judge to order P&P/DOC records to be unsealed and allow them access to that information. Court not aware of any authority to order the release of such confidential records. Stange responds. State responds. Stange asking that the file from DOC be produced to the Court to review. Stange to prepare an order for Court's signature for DOC to release their files sealed and in-camera to the Court. State has no objections to that. Stange will prepare Orders for both cases in regards to the released/unsealed documents requested by defense counsel.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Richard A Pitts in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.   Jodie Bednar-Clemens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:48 AM. Krueger and Pitts handed Information today, reviews with client, waives further reading, stands mute on plea. Court enters NG pleas on behalf of defendant, continues bond, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
#1 - FOSO section from Policies and Procedures Manual, #2 - TIME System Policy and Procedures Manual, #3 - Insurance claim from Traverlers, #4 - Incident Report from Hobar/Lawrence Police Department

Defendant Richard A Pitts in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 8:56 a.m. State has filed 3rd amended complaint. Krueger has received amended complaint - charges are same, time lines vary a bit. Smith has filed motion for return of property. State has no objections to return of property that is not in question of stolen property. Smith has filed an amended answer and motion for outrageous government conduct as well. Smith states motion. Court - proceed to preliminary hearing and address motion after. Court recess for Smith to review 3rd criminal complaint with client. Re-called 9:28 a.m. Same appearances. Smith states motion after reviewing the criminal complaint with defendant. Court will find that the criminal complaint states facts and a felony may have been committed and denies motion filed for dismissing amended criminal complaint. State calls Alex Walwrath 9:33 a.m. State offers exhibit #1 - pages from policy and procedure manual from Forest County Sheriff's Department. Objection - conclusion - over ruled 9:36 a.m. State offers exhibit #2 - copy of policy and procedures from TIME system. Objection - leading/conclusion - sustained 9:39 a.m. Objection - leading/conclusion - over ruled 9:40 a.m. Objection - over ruled 9:41 a.m. Smith cross exam 9:41 a.m. Parties stipulate that Mr. Pitts was never provided copies of Exhibits #1 & #2. State - objection - relevance - over ruled 9:46 a.m. Objection - argumentative - over ruled 9:48 a.m. Objection - relevance - sustained 9:50 a.m. Court receives Exhibits #1 & 2. Walwrath excused from witness stand 9:51 a.m. Smith asks for right to recall witnesses for motion hearing. Court agrees. State calls Jeremiah Winscher 9:52 a.m. Objection - leading - sustained 9:56 a.m. State offers Exhibit #3 - Insurance loss claim. Objection - heresay - over ruled 10:01 a.m. State offers Exhibit #4 - Police report form Hobart police department. Court finds defendant has properly been indentified 10:05 a.m. Smith cross examines 10:10 a.m. Objections - sustained 10:13 a.m. Objection - over ruled 10:17 a.m. Objection - relevance - sustained 10:23 a.m. Winscher excused 10:29 a.m. Court receives exhibit #3 & #4. State rests on testimony. Smith makes final argument. Court will find PC, bind over for trial. Set for ARGN on April 22, 2015 at 8:45 a.m. Bond - continued. Proceed to motion hearing. Smith filed motion regarding outrageous government conduct. State calls Thomas Robinson 10:33 a.m. Objection - argumentative - over ruled 10:36 a.m. Robinson excused from witness stand. Smith makes final argument. State makes final argument. Smith responds. Court denies motion for stated reasons.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion For Return of Property
Defendant's Reply Brief in Support of His Motion to Dismiss Criminal Complaint
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Amended Criminal Complaint

Preliminary hearing at 04-01-2015 08:45 am.
Motion hearing at 04-01-2015 08:45 am.

Defendant Jeanie  Pitts in court with attorney Dean A. Strang appearing telephonically.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:31 p.m Also called case 14CF157. AttorneyJane Smith also appears telephonically for Mr. Pitts with leave of the court. State has filed amended criminal complaint. MH and PH were to be held today, asking for adjournment due to emergency, officers are not available. All parties have no objection. Strang & Smith have copy of amended criminal complaints, waives further reading. State indicates charges have not changed, just the order of the complaints. Time limits were previously waived. Court will adjourn PH & MH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm for 14CF154 and motion hearing on same date and time. Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:45 am on this matter.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:45 am on 14CF157.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendants' Motins to Dismiss
State's Motion to Enlarge Time to File Reply Briefs and Order

Motion hearing at 03-25-2015 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 03-25-2015 01:30 pm.

Defendant Richard A Pitts in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:16 AM. Defense has complaint, waives reading of it - special appearance, has filed similar motion today as co-defendant. Court considers time limits waived and sets for MH and PH same date and time as co-defendant. Smith - bond - argues for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections to signature bond. Court reduces bond to $5000 signature bond and refund money to poster.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
